intro: Androcoma speciosa, commonly known as the showy sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are succulent and fleshy, helping it store water. The flowers are usually pink or purple, adding a striking visual element to its habitat.
